block.p: LEAD: The stock of Tandem Computers Inc. tumbled 15.6 percent yesterday, and several Wall Street analysts cut their earnings estimates after the company said late Monday that the United States economic slump could impede its growth. Tandem shares fell $2.125 each, to $11.50, on the New York Stock Exchange, where the percentage drop was the day's largest.

LEAD: The stock of Tandem Computers Inc. tumbled 15.6 percent yesterday, and several Wall Street analysts cut their earnings estimates after the company said late Monday that the United States economic slump could impede its growth. Tandem shares fell $2.125 each, to $11.50, on the New York Stock Exchange, where the percentage drop was the day's largest.
Tandem shares fell $2.125 each, to $11.50, on the New York Stock Exchange, where the percentage drop was the day's largest.

A Dean Witter analyst, Jay Stevens, said he had lowered his earnings estimate for the year ending this month to $1.10 a share, from $1.20. Barry Bosak of Smith Barney dropped his 1990 estimates to $1.06, from $1.20. A Paine Webber analyst, Stephen Smith, lowered his estimate to $1.10, from $1.25, but repeated his buy rating on the company.
